column4: Sounds like all you need to do is restore the MBR so that it runs Grub.  This is a common problem when installing Windows after you have linux installed.
can you please tell me how to do that?
Run Ubuntu as a live CD, go into repair mode then run grub-install as root is how I normally do it.

Hi, i've read: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/RecoveringUbuntuAfterInstallingWindows to recover from installing windows, but is there an easier way?
Did you try reinstalling grub in the MBR?
I'm serious, that might really be your only problem.  It only takes a few minutes to do.
how do you do that?
Easier than that web site is to just simply run the command "grub-install" instead of "grub".  Without the quotes of course.
grub-install?
Just get to a command line and type in sudo grub-install
